meanings.definition: The process of decline in industrial activity in a region or country.
meanings.sent1: The deindustrialization of the city led to many job losses.
meanings.sent2: The deindustrialization of the area resulted in abandoned factories.
meanings.sent3: The deindustrialization of the town made finding work a real challenge.
meanings.sent4: The deindustrialization of the region left behind empty warehouses and silent machines.
meanings.sent5: The deindustrialization of the country was like watching a once-busy hive become still.

meanings.definition: The reduction or elimination of industrial capacity or activity in a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The deindustrialization of the neighborhood caused economic hardship.
meanings.sent2: The deindustrialization of the town led to the closure of many businesses.
meanings.sent3: The deindustrialization of the city made the streets quieter than ever.
meanings.sent4: The deindustrialization of the region was a slow but steady process.
meanings.sent5: The deindustrialization of the area felt like a fading heartbeat of the economy.

meanings.definition: The shift from an industrial economy to a service-based or post-industrial economy.
meanings.sent1: The deindustrialization of the nation marked a new era of economic focus.
meanings.sent2: The deindustrialization of the region paved the way for new types of jobs.
meanings.sent3: The deindustrialization of the city brought about a wave of change.
meanings.sent4: The deindustrialization of the area hinted at a different future for its people.
meanings.sent5: The deindustrialization of the country was a turning point towards modernization.
